Code API¶

We document here the source code of the Escapad parser located in src folder. It is divided into 2 main parts:

  1. the parser model located in cnparser/model.py
  2. the rest of the parser code, that is the scripts that manipulate the files and generate the exports in Web, IMS and EDX formats

Detailed documentation of model.py¶

This file model.py contains the logic of the Escapad parser that parse a whle course directory to build a Course Program object. The order of presentation follows the building of Course Program structure whereby :

  • a CourseProgram contains one or several modules and is stored in a repository (folder)
  • A module is made of one source file that is parsed and optionnaly a media folder
  • Each module has a header part for the metadata and is divided in Sections, each containing one or several activities (AnyActivity)
  • Each activity can be typed as
    • Cours : can contain also video parts
    • AnyActivity that has 3 subclasses:
      • Comprehension: for simple quizzes
      • Activite (simple) : for simple exercises involving personnal research
      • ActiviteAvancee : for more advanced activity involving both research and personnal reflexion

Course Program¶

class model.CourseProgram(title, repository)[source]¶

A course program is made of one or several course modules. A CP is initiated from a repository containing global paramaters file (logo.jpg, title.md, home.md) and folders moduleX containing module file and medias

Paramètres:
  • title (string) – course title
  • repository (string) – path to the folder containing the modules

Module¶

class model.Module(f, name, base_url='http://culturenumerique.univ-lille3.fr')[source]¶

Module structure.

Paramètres:
  • f (File) – module source file pointer
  • name (string) – module name
  • base_url (string) – the base url to build absolute media paths (default to DEFAULT_BASE_URL)
parse(f)[source]¶

Parse module source file, starting by the head to retrieve the meta-data. Read all the lines until the start of a new section (see reStartSection regex). In this case, parsing is continued in Section.parse() method that returns a new Section object and the last line parsed. Parsing goes on until that last line returned is not the start of a new Section.

parseHead(f)[source]¶

Called by module.parse() method. Captures meta-data within the first lines of the source file. Stops and return the first line starting with #, which means the start of the first section

:param f : module source file pointer :type f: File

Type retourné:string, last line parsed
toCourseHTMLVisualisation()[source]¶

To CourseHTML with title (used for getting preview of the website)

Type retourné:Returns a string of the concatenation of their HTML output
toGift()[source]¶

Returns a text string with all questions of all the activities of this modules object. Can be used for import a questions bank into moodle

toHTML(feedback_option=False)[source]¶

triggers the generation of HTML output for all sections

toJson()[source]¶

Returns the JSON representation of the module object. Uses the custom ComplexEncoder class

toVideoList()[source]¶

Returns a text string with all video iframe codes

Section¶

class model.Section(title, f, module_name, base_url='http://culturenumerique.univ-lille3.fr')[source]¶

Class defining the section level in the course module model of Esc@pad

Paramètres:
  • title (string) – text string title
  • f (File) – module source file pointer
  • module_name (string) – text string of the module name
  • base_url (string) – base url for building absolute paths for relative media (default: DEFAULT_BASE_URL defined in model.py)
build_default_cours(text)[source]¶

Build a default Cours with text without subsections

Paramètres:body (String) – Text which contains a part of class
num = 1¶
parse(f)[source]¶

Read lines in file pointer “f” until the start of a new section. If the start of a new subsection or new activity is detected, parsing is continued in corresponding subsection parse method that returns the newly created object

toCourseHTMLVisualisation()[source]¶

Loops through Cours subsections only.

Type retourné:a string concatenating subsections HTML output
toGift()[source]¶

Returns a concatenation (text string) of the GIFT source code of all questions of all activities in this section

toHTML(feedback_option=False)[source]¶

Triggers the HTML output generation for all subsections. Does not return anything

toVideoList()[source]¶

Returns a text string containing all iframe code of all videos in this section

Subsection¶

class model.Subsection(section)[source]¶

Abstract class for any type of subsection: lectures and activities

Paramètres:section (Section object) – section object to which this subsection belongs
absolutizeMediaLinks()[source]¶

returns the instance src attribute (i.e the bit of source code corresponding to this subsection) modified so that relative media links are turned absolute with the base_url and the module name

getFilename(term='html')[source]¶

returns the filename associated to this subsection

Paramètres:term (string) – termination of the file (“html” or “xml”)
num = 1¶
parseMediaLinks()[source]¶

Parse instance src and search for video matches. In case of a match, creates a video object and assign it to self.videos list attribute.

returns True if the number of videos found is above 0,
False otherwise
rebaseMediaLinks(dest)[source]¶

changes the media links in the html_src code to a new link /<modulename>/media/ is converted into dest

toGift()[source]¶
toXMLMoodle()[source]¶

Cours¶

Subclass of Subsection

class model.Cours(section, file=None, src='', title='Cours')[source]¶

Class for a lecture. If src is not empty and no file is given, then this means that the content has already been parsed in Section.parse(). Else if a file pointer is given and param “src” is empty, this means that Section.parse() has detected a new “Cours” instance that we keep on parsing here.

Paramètres:
  • section (Section object) – containing section object (to be deleted in JSON representation, see ComplexEncoder class)
  • file (File pointer) – parsed file (default None)
  • src – text string with source of the parsed subsection (default: empty string)
  • title – text string that gives the Cours title (default “Cours”)
parse(f)[source]¶

Read lines in file pointer f until:

  • start of a new section
  • start of another subsection
  • start of a new (checked) activity
parseVideoLinks()[source]¶

Parse instance src and search for video matches. In case of a match, creates a video object and assign it to self.videos list attribute.

Retourne:True if the number of videos found is greater than 0
toHTML(feedback_option=False)[source]¶

Assign and return the html_src attribute, i.e the html representation of this Course subsection

Paramètres:feedback_option – determines wether or not it must include feedback and correct answer (default False)
videoIframeList()[source]¶

Generates and returns a text string containing all the iframe codes for a course subsection

AnyActivity¶

Subclass of Subsection

class model.AnyActivity(section, f)[source]¶
Abstract class for any activity.
Responsible for parsing questions from the gift code in src attribute
Paramètres:
  • section (Section object) – containing section object (to be deleted in JSON representation, see ComplexEncoder class)
  • file (File pointer) – parsed file (default None)
parse(f)[source]¶

Read lines in file pointer f until the end of the activity

toEdxProblemsList()[source]¶
Returns xml source code of all the questions in
EDX XML format. depends on toEdx.py module
Type retourné:texte string of xml code
toGift()[source]¶

Returns a text string containing the gift code of all the questions of this AnyActivity instance

toHTML(feedback_option=False)[source]¶
Assign and return the html_src attribute,
i.e. the concatenation of the HTML representation of all questions of this activity.
Paramètres:feedback_option (Boolean) – wether or not output should include feedbacks to the questions of the activity
Type retourné:text string with html code
toXMLMoodle()[source]¶

Returns the XML representation following IMS QTI standard of all the questions in this activity. depends on toIMS.py module

Type retourné:texte string of xml code

Autres modules¶

Here we detail the code documentation of the rest of the Escapad parser.

cnparser¶

fromGift¶

fromGift.aslistInteractionsIMS(self, doc, tag, text)[source]¶

return the list interactions in IMS form the class Answer (example : When someone have the good answer, or the bad.) Add XML in the yattag.doc

fromGift.asownEDX(self, doc)[source]¶

Transforms the answers into XML EDX according to their type

fromGift.aspossiblesAnswersIMS(self, doc, tag, text, rcardinality='Single')[source]¶

Return the list of possible responses, example for SelectSet(unique good answer) and MultipleChoicesSet (one or many good answer(s)).

Paramètres:rcardinality (String) – represent number of good answer(s)
fromGift.asscriptEDX(self, doc)[source]¶

In EDX, we can add a python or javascript script. This method allow to add script in XML EDX.

fromGift.astoEDX(self)[source]¶

transform object question in XML problem for EDX, depends to Answer type

Retourne:The doc value of XML text problem
Type retourné:String
fromGift.astoIMSFB(self, doc, tag, text)[source]¶

return the feedback for each answer.

fromGift.mdToHtml(text, doc=None)[source]¶

Transform txt in markdown to html

Paramètres:doc – yattag.doc()
Retourne:HTML text
Type retourné:String
fromGift.toEDX(self)[source]¶

produces an XML fragment for EDX, use toEDX from AnswerSet

Retourne:The doc value of XML text problem
Type retourné:String

toEDX¶

toEDX.generateEDXArchive(module, moduleOutDir)[source]¶

Given a module object and destination dir, generate EDX archive

toEDX.generateEDXArchiveIO(module, mediaFiles, mediaNames)[source]¶

Writes the EDX content in a zipfile and returns that zipfile. The structure of this archive is contained in a tree /<EDX_DIRECTORY>/ (usually EDX_DIRECTORY=EDX) and returns the zipfile.

toIMS¶

toIMS.create_empty_ims_test(id, num, title, max_attempts)[source]¶

create empty imsc test source code

toIMS.create_ims_test(questions, test_id, test_title)[source]¶
toIMS.generateIMSArchive(module, out_directory)[source]¶

Generate an IMS archive for a given module

Paramètres:
  • module_object – a module
  • out_directory – path of the output dir in which we create an IMS_DIRECTORY directory where out IMS data are located
toIMS.generateIMSArchiveIO(module, mediaFiles, mediaNames)[source]¶

Writes the IMS content in a zipfile and returns that zipfile. The structure of this archive is contained in a tree /<IMS_DIRECTORY>/ (usually IMS_DIRECTORY=IMS) and returns the zipfile as a StringIO.

toIMS.generateIMSManifest(m)[source]¶

parse m from config file “moduleX.config.json” and recreate imsmanifest.xml

toHTML¶

toHTML.buildSite(course_program, repoDir, outDir)[source]¶

Generate full site from result of parsing repository

utils¶

utils.add_target_blank(html_src)[source]¶

add target= »_blank » attribute to anchors in html_src

utils.cnslugify(value)[source]¶

Meant to be used as a tag in Jinja2 template, return the input string « value » turned into slugified version

utils.cntohtml(value)[source]¶

filter taking input in md or html and rendering it anyway

utils.copyMediaDir(repoDir, moduleOutDir, module_name)[source]¶

Copy the media subdir if necessary to the dest

utils.createDirs(outDir, folders)[source]¶

create anew all dirs in folders within target outdir

utils.create_empty_file_if_needed(filepath)[source]¶

Create an empty file filepath if it does not exist.

utils.fetch_vimeo_thumb(video_link)[source]¶

fetch video thumbnail for vimeo videos

Paramètres:video_link (String) – url
utils.get_embed_code_for_url(url)[source]¶

parses a given url and retrieve embed code.

Paramètres:url – url
utils.get_video_src(video_link)[source]¶

get video src link for iframe embed. FIXME : Supports only vimeo and canal-u.tv so far

utils.iframize_video_anchors(htmlsrc, anchor_class)[source]¶

given a piece of html code, scan for video anchors filtered by given class and add corresponding video iframe code before each anchor nb. uses get_embed_code_for_url()

utils.prepareDestination(BASE_PATH, outDir)[source]¶

Create outDir and copy mandatory files

utils.write_file(src, current_dir, target_folder, name)[source]¶

given a « src » source string, write a file with « name » located in « current_dir »/ »target_folder »

utils.writetarstr(tar, filepath, content)[source]¶

writes a string (content) in a tarfile
